intro: Louteridium tamaulipense, commonly known as the Tamaulipan louteridium, is a flowering plant native to the Tamaulipan moist forests of northeastern Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded understory environments. Due to its limited geographic distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within its native habitat.
